title: typeface classification
content:
hi,  
i’m trying to get a greater understanding of typefaces and their differences. and was wondering if any of you clever people could recommend a book on this subject. something that really goes in depth with the subject and shows/explains all the different typeface classifications etc.

thanks in advance  
anders

 [‹ Help Learning Grid Systems](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123025037/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33964 "Go to previous forum topic") [portfolio rip off ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123025037/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33671 "Go to next forum topic")
author: creativep

comments.content:
Two to start with:

Stop Stealing Sheep & find out how type works by Erik Spiekermann & E. M. Ginger

Elements of Typographic Style by Robert Bringhurst  
 [http://typophile.com/wiki/Elements%20of%20Typographic%20Style](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123025037/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Elements%20of%20Typographic%20Style "http://typophile.com/wiki/Elements%20of%20Typographic%20Style")

One of the things I consider to be a great help is that font badges poster from Linotype. It used to be free with every order - I got one hanging here, and it gives you a very quick overview how a typeface might be used. Like it very much.

Concerning books, Elements of Typographic Style is a good one, I definitely would agree!! :-)
ooops. got those. better read them again. are there any other titles?

Have a look at the typowiki, there are some books listed...  
 [http://typophile.com/wiki/Books](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123025037/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Books "http://typophile.com/wiki/Books")

First of all:  
Try to understand DIN 16 518:  
 [http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/DIN\_16518](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123025037/http:/de.wikipedia.org/wiki/DIN_16518 "http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/DIN\_16518")  
Yes, its in german. But very easy to understand ’cause you’ll find enough examples.  
Here you can find approx. 300 more examples:  
 [http://www.bleisetzer.de/cms/front\_content.php?idcat=41](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123025037/http:/www.bleisetzer.de/cms/front_content.php?idcat=41 "http://www.bleisetzer.de/cms/front\_content.php?idcat=41")

Here is another nice poster:  
 [http://cgi.ebay.de/Plakat-Schriftgiessereien-in-Deutschland-seit-Gutenbe...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123025037/http:/cgi.ebay.de/Plakat-Schriftgiessereien-in-Deutschland-seit-Gutenberg_W0QQitemZ280114856927QQihZ018QQcategoryZ78238QQssPageNameZWDVWQQrdZ1QQcmdZViewItem "http://cgi.ebay.de/Plakat-Schriftgiessereien-in-Deutschland-seit-Gutenberg\_W0QQitemZ280114856927QQihZ018QQcategoryZ78238QQssPageNameZWDVWQQrdZ1QQcmdZViewItem")

And if someone tells you this would be old stuff:  
How can you understand where you are going to without knowing where you are coming from?

Georg
